snippet: Politicians have called on social media to take down hateful language, and the government openly accuses the far right of organizing anti-immigrant rallies.
abstract: German government officials face growing and increasingly violent anti-immigration movement, including rise in assaults on migrants and migrant shelters; stabbing of Henriette Reker, senior official responsible for migrants in Cologne, brought stunned reactions from across country; government is openly accusing far right of organizing anti-immigrant rallies, and some officials are suggesting that hate speech be removed from social media in effort to quell rising tension.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Politicians have called on social media to take down hateful language, and the government openly accuses the far right of organizing anti-immigrant rallies.

headline.print_headline: German Violence Spurs Debate on Hate Speech
headline.main: Anti-Immigrant Violence in Germany Spurs New Debate on Hate Speech
